# supportsOnDeviceRecognition

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the speech recognizer can operate without network access.

## Declaration

```swift
var supportsOnDeviceRecognition: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

An [doc://com.apple.speech/documentation/Speech/SFSpeechRecognitionRequest] can only honor its [doc://com.apple.speech/documentation/Speech/SFSpeechRecognitionRequest/requiresOnDeviceRecognition] property if [doc://com.apple.speech/documentation/Speech/SFSpeechRecognizer/supportsOnDeviceRecognition] is `true`. If [doc://com.apple.speech/documentation/Speech/SFSpeechRecognizer/supportsOnDeviceRecognition] is `false`, the [doc://com.apple.speech/documentation/Speech/SFSpeechRecognizer] requires a network in order to recognize speech.

## Monitoring speech recognition availability

- **delegate**: The delegate object that handles changes to the availability of speech recognition services.
- **SFSpeechRecognizerDelegate**: A protocol that you adopt in your objects to track the availability of a speech recognizer.
- **isAvailable**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the speech recognizer is currently available.
